title: How to Make Marbled Chocolate Caramel Slice

steps.headline: Combine the butter, flour, and superfine sugar in a bowl with your hands.
steps.description: Mix thoroughly until the mixture resembles as fine breadcrumbs and a crumbly "dough".

steps.headline: Press the dough in a pre-greased or non-stick 13"x9" (23x33 cm) pan.
steps.description: Use the back of a spoon to smooth it evenly into the tin. Use fork prongs to prick all over and bake for 20 minutes. Set on the side to cool.

steps.headline: Add the brown sugar, diced butter, and condensed milk into a medium sized pan.
steps.description: Place over a low to medium heat and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Continue stirring and bring the mixture to a boil. Lower to a simmer and continue to stir for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Pour and layer the mixture carefully on top of the baked crust.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to spread evenly and place on the side to cool.

steps.headline: Place the semi-sweet, milk, and white chocolates into separate bowls.
steps.description: Melt each chocolate in the microwave until completely melted. Use a spoon to drizzle lines of the semi-sweet and milk chocolates over the caramel filling.

steps.headline: Add small spoonful "blobs" of melted white chocolate in random spots.
Swirl the melted chocolate carefully in circles to create marbled effects.
steps.description: A small knife tip, chopstick, or bamboo skewer works well.

steps.headline: Cool on the side and cut into pieces when the chocolate has completely solidified.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Combine the butter, flour, and superfine sugar in a bowl with your hands. Mix thoroughly until the mixture resembles as fine breadcrumbs and a crumbly "dough". Press the dough in a pre-greased or non-stick 13"x9" (23x33 cm) pan. Use the back of a spoon to smooth it evenly into the tin. Use fork prongs to prick all over and bake for 20 minutes. Set on the side to cool. Add the brown sugar, diced butter, and condensed milk into a medium sized pan. Place over a low to medium heat and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Continue stirring and bring the mixture to a boil. Lower to a simmer and continue to stir for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Pour and layer the mixture carefully on top of the baked crust. Use a rubber spatula to spread evenly and place on the side to cool. Place the semi-sweet, milk, and white chocolates into separate bowls. Melt each chocolate in the microwave until completely melted. Use a spoon to drizzle lines of the semi-sweet and milk chocolates over the caramel filling. Add small spoonful "blobs" of melted white chocolate in random spots.  Swirl the melted chocolate carefully in circles to create marbled effects. A small knife tip, chopstick, or bamboo skewer works well. Cool on the side and cut into pieces when the chocolate has completely solidified.
